questions.question: Who is Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero?
questions.answer: Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero is a Sri Lankan politician and a former Member of Parliament for the Colombo District. He served in Parliament from 2004 to 2010.

questions.question: When was Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero born?
questions.answer: Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero was born on 24 December 1970 in Akmeemana, Galle.

questions.question: What is Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero's educational background?
questions.answer: He has a Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Peradeniya.

questions.question: What political parties has Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero been affiliated with?
questions.answer: He has been affiliated with the Jathika Hela Urumaya, Sinhala Rawaya, and Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

questions.question: Who were Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero's family members mentioned in the document?
questions.answer: His mother's name is Siriyawathi, and his father's name was Sumatipala. He is also related to Mr. Sisira Udawatta, Mr. Nandalal Udawatta, and Mrs. Mallika Udawatta.

questions.question: What was Akmeemana Dayarathana Thero's role in the Parliament?
questions.answer: He was a Member of Parliament for the Colombo District from 2004 to 2010.

questions.question: Who is Anura Kumara Dissanayake?
questions.answer: Anura Kumara Dissanayake is a Sri Lankan politician and the current leader of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) and the National People's Power (NPP).

questions.question: When was Anura Kumara Dissanayake born?
questions.answer: Anura Kumara Dissanayake was born on 24 November 1968.

questions.question: Where was Anura Kumara Dissanayake born?
questions.answer: He was born in Thambuthegama, Anuradhapura District, North Central Province, Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Which university did Anura Kumara Dissanayake attend?
questions.answer: He attended the University of Kelaniya and graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Physical Science.

questions.question: What position does Anura Kumara Dissanayake currently hold?
questions.answer: He is the leader of both the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna and the National People's Power.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake become the leader of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna?
questions.answer: He became the leader of the JVP on 2 February 2014.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake become the leader of the National People's Power?
questions.answer: He became the leader of the NPP in 2019.

questions.question: What was Anura Kumara Dissanayake's role as Chief Opposition Whip?
questions.answer: He served as the Chief Opposition Whip from 3 September 2015 to 18 December 2018.

questions.question: Which district does Anura Kumara Dissanayake currently represent as a Member of Parliament?
questions.answer: He represents the Colombo District.

questions.question: Which districts did Anura Kumara Dissanayake represent in the past?
questions.answer: He has represented the Kurunegala District and the National List in the past.

questions.question: What ministerial role did Anura Kumara Dissanayake hold from 2004 to 2005?
questions.answer: He was the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land, and Irrigation.

questions.question: When was Anura Kumara Dissanayake first elected to Parliament?
questions.answer: He was first elected to Parliament in 2000 from the National List of the JVP.

questions.question: What were the results of Anura Kumara Dissanayake's candidacy in the 2019 presidential election?
questions.answer: He came in 3rd place with 418,553 votes, receiving 3% of the valid votes.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake serve as a Member of Parliament for the Kurunegala District?
questions.answer: He served from 1 April 2004 to 8 April 2010.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake serve as a Member of Parliament for the National List?
questions.answer: He served from 18 October 2000 to 7 February 2004 and from 22 April 2010 to 17 August 2015.

questions.question: What political parties has Anura Kumara Dissanayake been affiliated with?
questions.answer: He has been affiliated with the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) and the National People's Power (NPP).

questions.question: What did Anura Kumara Dissanayake criticize about the IMF?
questions.answer: He criticized the IMF for allegedly bailing out corrupt regimes and stated that some IMF conditions need to be renegotiated.

questions.question: What were Anura Kumara Dissanayake's views on tax reforms?
questions.answer: He proposed reducing taxes such as the Pay-as-you-earn tax, eliminating VAT on essential items, and increasing taxes on the wealthy.

questions.question: What notable position did Anura Kumara Dissanayake hold within the JVP before becoming its leader?
questions.answer: He was a member of the JVP Politburo and served as the National Organizer of the Socialist Students Association.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake resign from his ministerial portfolio?
questions.answer: He resigned on 16 June 2005.

questions.question: What was the reason for Anura Kumara Dissanayake's resignation from his ministerial role?
questions.answer: He resigned in opposition to President Kumaratunga's joint mechanism with the LTTE for tsunami relief coordination.

questions.question: What was Anura Kumara Dissanayake's position on the 2024 presidential election?
questions.answer: He is the National People's Power's presidential candidate for the 2024 Sri Lankan presidential election.

questions.question: What was Anura Kumara Dissanayake's role in student politics?
questions.answer: He was active in student politics while at university and was involved with the JVP from his school days.

questions.question: Which educational institution did Anura Kumara Dissanayake attend before transferring to the University of Kelaniya?
questions.answer: He attended the University of Peradeniya.

questions.question: What was Anura Kumara Dissanayake's role in the JVP during the 1987â€“1989 insurrection?
questions.answer: He was engaged in full-time political activities with the JVP during this period.

questions.question: When did Anura Kumara Dissanayake first get appointed to the JVP Politburo?
questions.answer: He was appointed to the Politburo in 1998.

questions.question: Which party did Anura Kumara Dissanayake represent in the 2004 parliamentary elections?
questions.answer: He represented the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) as part of the United People's Freedom Alliance (UPFA).

questions.question: What significant policy did Anura Kumara Dissanayake advocate for in the 2004 parliamentary elections?
questions.answer: He advocated for reducing the budget deficit and cutting government spending.

questions.answer: He focused on issues related to religious and social reforms, and was active in promoting Buddhist values and community development.

questions.answer: He served as the General Secretary of the Jathika Hela Urumaya.

questions.answer: His leadership style is often described as charismatic and reformist, with a strong emphasis on grassroots mobilization and progressive policies.

questions.answer: His campaign focused on anti-corruption, economic revitalization, and strengthening democratic institutions in Sri Lanka.

questions.answer: He was the leader of the National People's Power and led his party in the parliamentary elections, advocating for electoral reforms and transparency.
